Class OrderProperties

Namespace
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market
Assembly
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market.dll

The container to store all properties of Order Unlike Order and IOrderProperties this class is not immutable and allows to change its properties after creation Usually, this class is used to prepare all parameters and then pass it to order constructor Order(IOrderProperties)

[PublicAPI]
public class OrderProperties : IOrderProperties, IBrokerageProviderProvider, IOrderBasicParameters, IInstrumentProvider, ITradeQuantityProvider, IQuantityProvider, ITimeZoneProvider, IOrderLifeTimeParameters

Properties

AlgoKey

Contains a key that can be used by a strategy to distinguish its orders from other orders Also, InitiatorType in this case should be Automated, and AlgoKey should contain strategy AlgoKey.

public string? AlgoKey { get; set; }

Property Value

string

AppliedPosition

For netting positions (Netting) this parameter is not necessary, because the position is sole for each instrument But for hedging positions changes can be applied to already existing position, so if you have to modify existing position (instead of creating new one) you have to specify it by this parameter Pay attention that if applied position is set (not null), PositionImpact value does not make any sense Pay also attention, that instrument of position must be equal to instruments of orders Attention: the referred position has the parameters at the moment of order creation. If the position changes afterwards, the order still refers the detached copy of the position

public Position? AppliedPosition { get; set; }

Property Value

Position

BrokerageProvider

Reference to IBrokerageProvider

public IBrokerageProvider BrokerageProvider { get; }

Property Value

IBrokerageProvider

CreateTime

Server time of setting order The time is defined in TimeZone to which this order parameters relate

public DateTime CreateTime { get; set; }

Property Value

DateTime

Description

Description of the order, which can be set by client on order submission or changed at any other time

public string? Description { get; set; }

Property Value

string

FilledQuantity

For OrderState == Filled it is equal to Quantity, for OrderState == PartiallyFilled it is less than Quantity For all other states a value is not defined

public Quantity FilledQuantity { get; set; }

Property Value

Quantity

GoodTillDate

Time for GTD orders TimeInForce, Gtd The time is defined in the time zone of TimeZone PrimaryTimeZone

public DateTime GoodTillDate { get; set; }

Property Value

DateTime

GroupName

Client-side order group name. A user can use it to group his orders visually

public string? GroupName { get; set; }

Property Value

string

InitiatorType

Initiator of order: human (manual) or program (automated)

public InitiatorType InitiatorType { get; set; }

Property Value

InitiatorType

Instrument

Instrument. This property must always return not-nullable value If the provider may return null then consider using INullableInstrumentProvider

public Instrument Instrument { get; }

Property Value

Instrument

LimitPrice

Limit price for limit or stop limit orders NaN means the limit price is not set

public double LimitPrice { get; set; }

Property Value

double

LocalCreateTime

Local time of setting order

public DateTime LocalCreateTime { get; set; }

Property Value

DateTime

LocalId

Order id, assigned locally. This Id is persistent during current application session. Once assigned to the order, it will be the same during the current session

public string? LocalId { get; set; }

Property Value

string

LocalUpdateTime

Local time of last order's change

public DateTime LocalUpdateTime { get; set; }

Property Value

Message

Broker response/comment of setting order

public string? Message { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Oco

One-cancel-other identifier for coupling several orders

public string? Oco { get; set; }

Property Value

string

OrderId

Order id, assigned by broker Usually before the state Accepted or this Id is null

public string? OrderId { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Remarks

To stress out, that this id is broker specific, we use OrderId instead of Id (because Id is too general name)

OrderState

Current state of the order

public OrderState OrderState { get; set; }

Property Value

OrderState

OrderType

Order type: market, limit, stop etc

public OrderType OrderType { get; set; }

Property Value

PositionImpact

The type of order's impact to current position (modify existing position, or create new one etc)

public OrderPositionImpact PositionImpact { get; set; }

Property Value

OrderPositionImpact

Remarks

Quantity

An numeric value representing quantity

public Quantity Quantity { get; set; }

Property Value

Quantity

StopLoss

The stop order (also known as stop loss) that will be attached to position when this order fills StopLossParameters StopLimitOrder documentation for more details

public StopLimitOrder? StopLoss { get; set; }

Property Value

StopLimitOrder

Remarks

This is a particular case of if-done order attached to master order. As soon as master order fills, if-done orders get activated. For simplicity if-done order collection is limited by 2 orders max (stop and limit order) Possibly, in future this limitation will be removed

StopPrice

Stop price for stop or stop limit orders NaN means the stop price is not set

public double StopPrice { get; set; }

Property Value

double

StrategyName

Contains strategy name, if this order was submitted by strategy. Also, InitiatorType in this case should be Automated, and AlgoKey should contain strategy AlgoKey.

public string? StrategyName { get; set; }

Property Value

string

TakeProfit

The limit order (also known as take profit) that will be attached to position when this order fills TakeProfitParameters StopLimitOrder documentation for more details

public StopLimitOrder? TakeProfit { get; set; }

Property Value

StopLimitOrder

Remarks

This is a particular case of if-done order attached to master order. As soon as master order fills, if-done orders get activated. For simplicity if-done order collection is limited by 2 orders max (stop and limit order) Possibly, in future this limitation will be removed

TimeInForce

Time-in-force mode (how long order will be alive)

public TimeInForce TimeInForce { get; set; }

Property Value

TimeInForce

TimeZone

Returns a time zone which a provider uses for as a primary time zone

public TimeZoneInfo TimeZone { get; }

Property Value

TimeZoneInfo

Remarks

For the specified instrument it is better to use TradingHours and TimeZone
